question: How do I register a new account?
answer: Click the Register button on the login page, fill in your details, and submit the form. Your account will be created as a Customer by default. Use a valid email to ensure communication and ticket updates.

question: What information do I need to register?
answer: Provide your full name, email, phone number, username, and a secure password. Passwords must be at least 8 characters with a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters.

question: How do I log in to the system?
answer: Visit the login page, enter your registered username and password, and click Login. You'll be authenticated via JWT token and redirected to your role-specific dashboard.

question: I forgot my password. How do I recover it?
answer: Currently, password recovery isn't automated. Please email admin@helpdeskpro.com with your username to request a password reset.

question: How can I change my password?
answer: Password change functionality is not yet available in the UI. Please contact an admin at admin@helpdeskpro.com to request a password update.

question: How do I create a support ticket?
answer: After login, go to the Create Ticket page, fill in the subject, description, priority, and department, then click Submit. You’ll get a confirmation message, and your ticket will appear under My Tickets.

question: What details are required in a ticket?
answer: Include a clear subject, detailed description, priority level (Low/Medium/High), and choose the relevant department. Adding context helps assigned agents resolve your issue faster.

question: Can I view the tickets I submitted?
answer: Yes. Use the View Tickets section in your dashboard to see all your submitted tickets, along with filters for status, priority, and department.

question: How do I check the status of my ticket?
answer: Each ticket shows its current status: Pending (awaiting agent assignment), In Progress (being handled by an agent), Resolved (agent has provided a solution), or Closed (you have confirmed the issue is resolved). You can view this in the 'My Tickets' section.

question: What do the ticket statuses mean?
answer: Pending: Your ticket has been submitted and is awaiting agent assignment. In Progress: An agent is currently working on it. Resolved: The agent has provided a solution and is waiting for your confirmation. Closed: You have marked the ticket as resolved and closed it.

question: Can I delete a ticket?
answer: Yes. As a customer, you can delete your own tickets from the View Tickets section. Agents and Admins cannot delete tickets submitted by others. Deleted tickets are permanently removed from your view.

question: Who can see my submitted tickets?
answer: Only you (as the customer), the assigned agent, and admins can access your ticket. Data is protected using role-based access and JWT-authenticated sessions.

question: Can I assign a ticket to an agent?
answer: No. Tickets are either manually assigned by an admin or picked up by agents themselves from the unassigned list. Customers cannot assign tickets directly.

question: What roles are supported in the system?
answer: The system has three roles: Customer (ticket creation), Agent (ticket management), and Admin (full control including assignment and user management).

question: I registered, but can't log in. What do I do?
answer: Double-check your username and password, and ensure caps lock is off. Clear your browser cache and try again. If it still fails, contact support.

question: Why is my ticket not yet resolved?
answer: Tickets are resolved based on their priority: High (4–8 hrs), Medium (1–2 days), and Low (2–4 days). Complex issues may take longer. You can filter tickets based on priority to check your queue.

question: Can I upload images with my ticket?
answer: Image upload is not available yet. For now, describe the issue clearly or include external screenshot links.

question: Is there a mobile version of the site?
answer: Yes. The app is responsive and works well on all screen sizes. You can access it using any modern mobile browser.

question: How do I contact the HelpDesk team?
answer: Create a ticket using the Create Ticket page for any issues. Direct contact with admins is not currently shown on the dashboard. More contact options will be added in future updates.

question: What technologies are used in this platform?
answer: HelpDesk Pro uses React.js with Tailwind CSS for the frontend, Spring Boot with JWT authentication for the backend, MySQL for data, and REST APIs for communication.

question: How do I update my profile information?
answer: Profile update functionality is currently not available. If you need to change your contact information, please contact the admin at admin@helpdeskpro.com for manual support.

question: Is my data secure on this platform?
answer: Yes. The platform uses JWT authentication, secure HTTPS, role-based access, and industry-standard data protection measures.

question: Can I receive email notifications for ticket updates?
answer: Email notifications are currently not supported. Please check your ticket status regularly by logging into your account.

question: What should I do if the system is running slowly?
answer: Refresh the page, clear your browser cache, or try another browser. If the issue persists, contact support. Backend issues may be involved.

question: Are there any browser requirements?
answer: Use modern browsers like Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Edge 90+, or Safari 14+. Ensure JavaScript is enabled for best performance.
